title: Software Engineer
job description: We are offering an exciting opportunity for a Software Engineer based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this role, you will have a pivotal part in the development and maintenance of our data transmission services and tools, from the ingestion of raw data to the delivery of cleaned, linked data. Your work will directly impact internal teams by providing them with applications they can use, as well as contribute to the efficient processing and delivery of large data quantities.Responsibilities:Develop services that facilitate the ingestion, storage, and extraction of data throughout our data ecosystemDesign and build APIs that support data pipelinesCreate applications that enable internal teams to configure data pipelinesDevelop tools that orchestrate and automate data pipelinesCollaborate with a team of driven engineers, engaging in paired programming and code reviewsWork closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and eliminate ambiguityDesign, discuss, implement, and ship solutions that support the healthcare insights economyCollaborate with our product teams to understand user needs and build software that addresses those needsImprove the software development process through agile ceremoniesMentor engineers and foster an environment of collaboration and learningProficiency in Apache Struts is required.Must have experience with C++ programming language.Database management skills are essential.Familiarity with EO/IR systems is a prerequisite.Hibernate ORM knowledge is expected.Capability in AB Testing is needed.Ajax skills are mandatory.API Development experience is a must.Knowledge of ASP.NET is necessary.CSS programming skills are required.Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do. ®Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. title: Software Development & DevOps Engineer
job description: Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)Job SummaryJob Description Summary The Next Generation Access Networks organization is a highly agile, fast paced and dedicated group responsible for the network serving our customers representing over 400,000 miles of fiber-coax plant and the delivery of 115+ Tbps of edge capacity to our customers. We lead and oversees the delivery of every service and every bit that is delivered to the home. The group also owns the design, development, construction and incubation of next-gen access architectures for residential, multi-family, and commercial networks. This includes the delivery of DOCSIS 3.1 powered gig Internet services, the transition to NFV/SDN on the Access network by virtualizing the CMTS core and transition to new digital nodes. The software applications we are building is a containerized, microservice-based, cloud-deployed services. We are working to bring X1 innovation and the power of network virtualization and software defined networks to the data delivery world. This role will be changing the industry forever!Job DescriptionThe Software Development & DevOps Engineer will take an essential part of the oversee and actively manage operational tech challenges in our Core Virtualization project as well as operational related software development. We are looking for a collaborative and results oriented developer who has depth in Kubernetes, Networks, operations technical analysis & development life cycle (Agile & DevOps). The engineer will be highly powered to design and lead operational needs to reach to the highest levels of system availability.RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for the day-to-day Comcast’s Access Network system operation with concentration on metrics data collection, analysis, reporting, tools and solutions development, systems integration and operational support.Write tested, production-ready code.Participate in software release and deployment activities managed under an agile software development approach.Support production environments. Perform troubleshooting of issues within a containerized application environment. Produce root cause analysis independently and by collaborating with other operational support teams (e.g. network support, divisions, and vendors).Participate in design and architecture sessions.Build effective deployment and monitoring systems.Work closely with Development, Deployment, Incident, Problem, Quality, Program, Product and Management teams.Collaborate constructively with team members.Ability to work under pressure being adaptable and responsive to organizational requirements.Maintain high degree of self-motivation and independent decision making.Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Must Have:Must have experience and practical knowledge of microservice architecture, containerized deployment, Docker, Kubernetes and Ansible.Must have experience and practical knowledge of networking protocols: IPv4, TCP/IP, and UDP/IP, IPv6, multicast, BGP, ISIS.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.Experience with operational open source tools and technologies such as Prometheus, Alert Manager, Elastic Search, Kibana, Kafka, Grafana, Thanos, Redis, RabbitMQ.Experience in one of the following: C++, Java, Go, Python.Experience in Switching and Routing with hands on experience with Cisco/Juniper switches.Good current knowledge of Unix/Linux environments.Experience with shell scripting to automate tasks and perform basic data analysis.Experience in Test-driven development/test automation, continuous integration, and deployment automation.Good communicator, able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly.Great design and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting at scale.Adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.Keen attention to detail and high level of commitment.Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets.Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols.Familiarity with data serialization formats like XML, JSON and protocol buffers.Know your stuff. A hardworking learner, user and advocate of our groundbreaking technology.High level of accountability – takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution.About Our Perks & Benefits:We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated.Here's a look at just some of the perks and benefits we make available to our US-based employees:Learn more atjobs.comcast.com/life-at-comcast/benefitsWe will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.Disclaimer:*This position is unable to provide work authorization sponsorship or immigration support now or in the future.*Comcast is anEOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTemployer.Medical & Dental401(k) Savings PlanGenerous paid time offLife Milestones - from adoption assistance, childcare resources, pet insurance, and more, Comcast supports you at all life stages.Courtesy Services - We offer all of our full-time employees in serviceable areas free digital TV and internet.Discount tickets for Universal Resorts, including theme park tickets and onsite hotel rooms.This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. We are looking for a collaborative and results oriented developer who has depth in Kubernetes, Networks, operations technical analysis & development life cycle (Agile & DevOps). The engineer will be highly powered to design and lead operational needs to reach to the highest levels of system availability.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for the day-to-day Comcast’s Access Network system operation with concentration on metrics data collection, analysis, reporting, tools and solutions development, systems integration and operational support. Write tested, production-ready code. Participate in software release and deployment activities managed under an agile software development approach. Support production environments. Perform troubleshooting of issues within a containerized application environment. Produce root cause analysis independently and by collaborating with other operational support teams (e.g. network support, divisions, and vendors). Participate in design and architecture sessions. Collaborate constructively with team members. Ability to work under pressure being adaptable and responsive to organizational requirements. Must have experience and practical knowledge of networking protocols: IPv4, TCP/IP, and UDP/IP, IPv6, multicast, BGP, ISIS. Experience with shell scripting to automate tasks and perform basic data analysis. Experience in Test-driven development/test automation, continuous integration, and deployment automation. Good communicator, able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly. Great design and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting at scale. Adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership. Keen attention to detail and high level of commitment. Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets. Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols. Familiarity with data serialization formats like XML, JSON and protocol buffers. Know your stuff. A hardworking learner, user and advocate of our groundbreaking technology. High level of accountability – takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution. title: Senior Software Engineer-9754
job description: FreeWheel, a Comcast company, provides comprehensive ad platforms for publishers, advertisers, and media buyers. Powered by premium video content, robust data, and advanced technology, we’re making it easier for buyers and sellers to transact across all screens, data types, and sales channels. As a global company, we have offices in nine countries and can insert advertisements around the world.Job SummaryJob DescriptionDUTIES: Provide technical leadership in designing and developing new software and web applications, and building ETL pipelines using Python; write queries and analyze datasets with SQL; set up and maintain Kubernetes cluster environments; perform CI/CD development using Jenkins, Kubernetes, BitBucket, and Docker; monitor software development operations using Grafana, Prometheus, Elasticsearch, Kibana, and Logstash or Fluentd; design, architect, develop and maintain applications in Java and Angular; support applications under development and customize current applications; assist with the software update process for existing applications, and roll-outs of software releases; analyze, test, and assist with the integration of new applications; document all development activity; research, write, and edit documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports; monitor and evaluate competitive applications and products; review literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects; collaborate with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements; conduct analysis to determine integration needs; work with the Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements; and guide and mentor junior-level engineers. title: Senior Software Engineer/ Python/ Django/ Typescript
job description: Security is a growing concern for many enterprises companies today, and there are many solutions suitable with continuously testing enterprise systems for vulnerabilities and weaknesses. If you’re interested in working on a world class product that will help solve this problem, this could be a job for you.Our client is looking for a back end software engineer with hands-on experience with Python. However, they also have services built with Golang. In this role you will be working on their detection platform, building out APIs and microservices from scratch. Experience with design architecture will be preferred, but not required. Experience in the cybersecurity space is not required.They are a small company environment, with a flat organization structure, where you get a seat at the table to make decisions on their flagship platform. Offer includes base salary, equity, and fantastic benefits. title: Senior Software Developer
job description: Job Title:Senior Software DeveloperJob Location:Philadelphia, PAMinimum Experience:7 YearsJob Type:Full-TimeJob Description:Join a leading innovator in Practice Management and Electronic Health Records (EHR) software, transforming how mental health professionals manage their practices. We offer a cutting-edge SaaS solution that integrates patient scheduling, medical records, billing, and electronic claims. Our dynamic team thrives on collaboration and innovation, continuously advancing in the healthcare and technology fields. If you are passionate about technology and mental health, this is the place to realize your potential.Role Overview:We are seeking a Senior Software Developer to join our expanding team. This role requires a passionate and experienced engineer skilled in building scalable, responsive web applications and services. You will work in a collaborative, team-oriented environment, utilizing technologies such as C#, Web API, TypeScript, and JavaScript. Expertise in modern web technologies like web sockets and service workers is essential, along with the ability to develop single-page applications (SPAs) and progressive web apps (PWAs). This role also involves mentoring and fostering expertise within the team.Responsibilities:Engage in full-stack development, including front end, business logic, and data access layers.Utilize a technology stack that includes C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, HTML, ASP.NET, AJAX, PL/SQL, and WCF.Manage the full development life cycle, from planning to successful release and support.Participate in software architecture and design decision-making processes.Conduct code reviews to ensure high-quality standards.Mentor and assist in training and onboarding new team members.Collaborate closely with other development team members and stakeholders.Maintain high standards of accuracy, attention to detail, and completeness.Qualifications:Minimum 7 years of experience developing software in an Agile, team-based environment.At least 3 years of experience developing responsive web applications.BS and/or MS in a technical discipline (Computer Science or Software Engineering preferred).Strong understanding of OOP concepts and design patterns.Expertise with C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Bootstrap, CSS, and HTML.Proven experience in building SPAs and PWAs.Strong knowledge of web and browser technologies such as web sockets, service workers, LocalStorage, SessionStorage, and W3C manifests.Experience with frameworks such as Node.js and React.Familiarity with CSS preprocessors like SASS or LESS is a plus.Experience in building RESTful web services using Web API.Proficiency with PostgreSQL or other relational databases.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Competencies:Innovation:Demonstrates creativity and resourcefulness, generates suggestions for improvements, and develops innovative approaches and ideas.Problem Solving:Identifies and resolves problems effectively, gathers and analyzes information skillfully, and works well in group problem-solving situations.Adaptability:Adjusts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands, and deals with frequent changes, delays, or unexpected events effectively.Teamwork:Balances team and individual responsibilities, welcomes feedback, contributes to positive team spirit, and supports team success.Benefits:Competitive salaryComp-time and flexible work hoursComprehensive health, life, disability, and dental insuranceRetirement plan with company contributionAnnual company profit sharingPersonal development/training budgetOpen, collaborative work environmentExtensive 2-week onboarding planComprehensive mentorship programCompany-provided refreshmentsAdditional Information:Thinking Minds Inc. is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all applicants are considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. Successful candidates will undergo a criminal background check as part of the employment process.If you are excited about technology and mental health, we invite you to apply and join our mission to shape the future of behavioral health software.

title: Architect 5, Software Architecture-4788
job description: Comcast Business offers a suite of Connectivity, Communications, Networking, Cybersecurity, Wireless, and Managed Solutions to help global organizations of all sizes prepare for what’s next. Powered by the nation’s largest Gig-speed broadband network and backed by 24/7 customer support, Comcast Business is the nation’s largest technology provider to small businesses and one of the leading service providers to the Enterprise market. Comcast Business has been consistently recognized by industry analysts and associations as a leader and innovator, and one of the fastest growing providers of Ethernet services.Job SummaryJob DescriptionDUTIES: Provide technical leadership in designing and developing new software and web applications; utilize HTML5 and CSS3 to define the structure of the web page and to enhance the layout and appearance of the webpage; use latest ECMAscript 6 features including Class, Promise, Modules, Generators, and arrow functions; use React for developing backend in Node.js; develop software using Agile methodologies; use JavaScript and Node.js server to create REST API Endpoints; write Web Services with Node.js including back-end services, Cross-Domain, Server-Side requests and multiple client communication; use Node.js, NPM, Grunt, Gulp, webpack and Bower in a Node environment; develop Node.js and Express.js to run script in sever-side and to develop the server-based applications and divert users to routes; use front-end development tools including Babel, Webpack, and NPM; use source code control systems including GIT, JIRA, and Jenkins; use GitHub to conduct modern distributed source code management; use TypeScript to add additional syntax to JavaScript; ensure programs are envisioned, designed, developed and implemented across the enterprise to meet business needs; interface with the enterprise architecture team and other functional areas to ensure that most efficient solution is designed to meet business needs; ensure solutions are well engineered, operable, maintainable and delivered on schedule; develop, document, and ensure compliance with best practices including but not limited to coding standards, object-oriented design, platform and framework specific design concerns and human interface guidelines; monitor emerging technologies/technology practices for potential use within the Company; design and develop updated infrastructure in support of one or more business processes; mentor, review code and verify that object-oriented design best practices and coding and architectural guidelines are adhered to; contribute to the overall system implementation strategy for the enterprise; gather and understand client needs to find key areas where technology leverage is possible to improve business processes; define architectural approaches, develop technology proofs, and communicate technology direction; monitor the project lifecycle from intake through delivery; and ensure the entire solution design is complete and consistent. title: Sr Data Engineer
job description: This marketing and sales company creates editorial content across hundreds of tech-specific websites and thousands of channels and is actively seeking to add a Senior Data Engineer to their Philadelphia-based team.Required Skills & Experience10+ years of experience working in a related roleBS Degree in Computer Science or related fieldProven ability to execute industry best practices in data engineeringData modeling, database design, and developing large scale pipelinesWhat You Will Be DoingTech Breakdown:Proficient in Python/SQLDeveloping large scale ETL/ELT pipelines for the cloudDeveloping Rest APIsAirflow and GCPExperience in Big Data tech stack (BigQuery preferred)You will receive the following benefits:Health, Dental, Vision, and 401k plansApplicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis now and in the future.

title: Applications Systems Engineer
job description: Duration : 12 MonthsOnsite - can be hybridLocation:400 N. Broad St., Suite 02-007Philadelphia, PA 19130Position overview :The Application Systems Engineer position is a hybrid role centered around Application Development, Application Support, and Platform engineering. This resource will engage in assessments on performance and functionality for troubleshooting and creating enhancements on existing applications. This also applies towards developing new software/application solutions to meet business needs. The resource will act as an in-house technical lead for consulting on application projects including working with vendors and stakeholders to understand and translate requirements for solution designs and implementation plans. This resource will also develop internal applications to support modernization of IT Systems and Operations.In addition, they will be collaborating with Platform Engineering team to optimize Server/VM, Web, and Database components in application stacks Work activities:Evaluating applications for “best-practice” implementations, including functionality and integration• Developing software/application solutions to meet business and operations needs • Collecting application and/or reporting requirements for solutions design • Managing and troubleshooting performance issues and resolving server/OS-related application issuesDocumenting solutions using application development cycle methodologies, diagrams, and application modelsPerforming application/software code reviews for improvements, enhancements, and optimizationReviewing security controls in applications and corresponding infrastructure for IT security complianceDesigning, developing, and managing front-end and back-end application components including user interfaces and database integrationsAnalyzing application datasets to formulate reports and reporting templatesProviding input/feedback with technical subject matter expertise on application projectsMaintaining server components in application stacksSkills/experience Required:Strong development skills in .Net, C++, Python, Java, XML, JSON and GOWorking foundation on front-end design protocols including PHP, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, and GOStrong web development skills with platforms such as Microsoft IIS, Visual Studio, Apache, NGINX, Node.JS, and DjangoStrong comprehension with SQL platforms including MS SQL Server, Oracle, and PostgreSQLDesigning, creating and supporting reports using SQL Server Reporting ServicesDesigning and supporting ETL and ELT processing using SQL Server Integration ServicesManaging and configuring desktop and server operating systems:Windows 10 and 11Windows Server 2016 and aboveRed Hat Enterprise Linux (or similar distributions)Administering system changes/modifications within operating systemsUnderstanding and implementing security at the Network, Application, Server, and Database levelFirm development skills in in scripting technologies for process automation or service optimizationVB Script, Powershell, BASH, Python, or similar• Strong soft and organizational skills in areas including teamwork, managing priorities, time management, task tracking, establishing effective relationships, communicating complex Ideas to non-technical people, and good oral and writing communication • Working knowledge on server infrastructure virtualization is a strong plusWorking knowledge on app deployments in AWS, Azure, or similar cloud environments is a plusWorking knowledge on Mainframe systems and COBOL, CICS, JCL, VSAM languages is a strong plusFamiliarity with Microsoft 365 suite of applications.Highly PreferredStrong development skills in.Net, C++, Python, Java, XML, JSON, and GOStrong web development skills with platforms such as Microsoft IIS, Visual Studio, Apache, NGINX, Node.JS, and DjangoStrong comprehension with SQL platforms including MS SQL Server, MySql, Oracle, and PostgreSQLWorking knowledge on server infrastructure virtualization is a strong plusWorking knowledge on app deployments in AWS, Azure, or similar cloud environments is a plusWorking knowledge on Mainframe systems and COBOL, CICS, JCL, VSAM languages is a strong plus.

title: DevOps Engineer III
job description: We are in search of a skilled DevOps Engineer III to be part of our team. The role is located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and offers a long-term contract employment opportunity. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be expected to utilize your expertise in networking, Python, monitoring tools, AWS technologies, and other relevant skills to automate and streamline our operations and processes.Responsibilities:Use scripting development languages such as Bash, Go, and Python to automate routine tasks.Utilize Ansible, Terraform and other automation software to manage infrastructure.Monitor system performance using tools like Grafana, InfluxDB, Datadog, and CloudWatch.Build and deploy automation tools for testing, releasing, monitoring, and alarming.Manage IaaS and PaaS providers like AWS, OpenStack, VMWare, etc.Perform Linux command-line system administration and install software on Linux platforms.Understand container technologies like Docker, Fargate, ECS, or Kubernetes and run containers on these platforms.Implement networking knowledge, including OSI network layers, TCP/IP, Firewalls, traffic shaping, and load balancing.Familiarize yourself with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as Jenkins, Concourse, etc.Deploy and operate infrastructure running microservices-based platforms.Job Requirements:Solid experience in scripting and development languages such as Bash, Go, Python, etc.Experience with automation software using Ansible, HashiCorp stack, and Python.Proficiency with monitoring systems like Grafana/InfluxDB, Datadog, CloudWatch, etc.Experience in building tools for automation:building, testing, releasing, monitoring, and alarming.Familiarity with IaaS and PaaS providers such as AWS, OpenStack, and VMWare.Competence with Linux command Line, system administration, and installing software on Linux platforms.Understanding of container technologies like Docker, Fargate, ECS, or Kubernetes. Practical experience with building and running containers on these platforms is a plus.Basic knowledge of networking (OSI network layers, TCP/IP, firewalls, traffic shaping, and load balancing).Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as Jenkins, Concourse, etc.Experience with deploying and operating infrastructure running microservices-based platformsTechnology Doesn't Change the World, People Do. ®Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. title: Network Engineer/Admin
job description: 6.0 - 7.0 YearsPosted on: Jun-12-2024Job Classification:other information technologyLocation:El Segundo, CASkills:VMWare, F5 Load Balancing, OSPF, HSRP, Prisma, Cisco MerakiDescription:TITLE: Sr. Engineer - Network"Must Haves"Routing and switching with Cisco Nexus -AnswerLayer 3 tech, BGP, yet OSPE or HSRP is fine. -AnswerPalo Alto Firewall in depth, expert level. -AnswerPanorama Virtual Appliance (almost a must, as long as you are an expert in configuring Palo Alto). -AnswerF5 Load Balancers is also a plus (we can train). -AnswerVMWare Networking. -AnswerCisco UCS Cyber Interconnect - -AnswerJOB DESCRIPTION:This role will oversee and manage all aspects of the Beachbody network infrastructure including but not limited to: -Corporate Office Networking including LAN, WLAN and WANDatacenter Networking TechnologiesDatacenter Storage Area NetworkingNetwork Security Technologies Enterprise WidePublic Cloud Networking in AWSThird party connectivity e.g. VPNsExpectations of the Senior Network Engineer include: -Provide 3rd level technical support for our LAN/WAN, Wireless & Security technologies.Someone with great planning skills especially when it comes to more complex changes which could potentially cause an outage.To be innovative and somebody who Initiates and influences opportunities for improvement.Sets a good example to the team and has a positive ‘can do’ attitude.Documents work in a professional manner.Takes pride in their work and has attention to detail.Follows strict change management procedures.Somebody with excellent communication skills.Has a passion for networking and actively tries to stay current with the latest networking technologies.Somebody who has the flexibility to perform a wide range of work.Network engineering experience within a large server environment.Experience in cloud computing concepts particularly in relation to networking and securityREQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES WILL INCLUDE:A solid routing and switching background e.g. experience with Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, ASR, ISR equipment.Knowledge and experience of Layer 3 technologies e.g. OSPF, BGP and HSRP.Knowledge of experience of layer 2 technologies e.g. Spanning-tree, VPCs.Paloalto firewall and Panorama configuration for all aspects of security policies, application filters, security profiles, URL Filtering, SSL Decryption, Site-to-Site VPN and Globalprotect VPN configurations. Extensive knowledges of device-groups and templates also required.Advanced administration of F5 BIG IP. This includes F5 Networking, LTM virtual server creation, web redirects, SSL certification management, irules, advanced load balancing, advanced health monitors, security configurations on AFM, F5 network, VCMP etc.Troubleshooting application flows with app developers, good understanding on how to use TCPDUMP and Wireshark etc. to troubleshoot suspected network issues.Coordination, deployment, and rotation of public and private SSL certificates for infrastructure and public facing resourcesExperience with Cisco Unified Computing and how to manage the UCSMGood understanding of VMware Networking and experience troubleshooting the network and storage connectivity with the Fabric InterconnectsResponsible for Management and Maintenance both internal and external DNS including all A records, CNAMEs, MX records, SPF, etc.AWS networking and security experience e.g. VPCs, NACLs, security groups, route tables, elastic load balancers, directconnect, transit gateway, route 53SKILLS WHICH ARE ADVANTAGEOUS BUT NOT REQUIREDKnowledge and experience of Cisco ACI, e.g. experience managing APIC, L3outs, contracts, bridge domains, EPGs, VMM integration, switch profiles etcManagement and maintenance of Cisco UC environment. This includes Cisco Voice server/applications - CUCM, Unity, voice gateway, Cube, SIP circuits, POTS lines, DIDs etcExperience with network tools such as LiveAction and NetbrainKnowledge and experience with Cisco ISE in respect to device administration e.g. AAA and TACACS+Experience with Cisco MDS administration specifically around zoning.Experience with Cisco Meraki switches and Meraki wireless access points.Knowledge and experience with Paloalto Prisma Access.  Posted on: Jun-12-2024 TITLE: Sr. Engineer - Network  "Must Haves"  JOB DESCRIPTION:  This role will oversee and manage all aspects of the Beachbody network infrastructure including but not limited to: -  Expectations of the Senior Network Engineer include: -  REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES WILL INCLUDE:  SKILLS WHICH ARE ADVANTAGEOUS BUT NOT REQUIRED

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
job description: Business Intelligence EngineerLocation:Philadelphia, PA (5 days a week onsite; potential for hybrid work after initial implementation)Salary Range:$95,000 - $115,000Job Summary:The Business Intelligence Engineer will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. This individual will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions, as well as providing IT support across various levels of the organization. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools, combined with the willingness to engage in hands-on technical work.Key Responsibilities:Business Intelligence and Reporting:Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions using PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools.Create and manage dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to support business objectives.Collaborate with various departments to gather requirements and ensure BI solutions meet business needs.Perform data analysis and provide actionable insights to improve decision-making processes.Develop and maintain data models, ETL processes, and data warehouses.IT Support:Provide help desk support to end-users, addressing technical issues and resolving them in a timely manner.Assist with the installation, configuration, and maintenance of hardware, software, and network systems.Troubleshoot and resolve IT-related issues, including system performance, connectivity, and application errors.Ensure data security and integrity by implementing and maintaining appropriate IT security measures.Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls.Project Management:Lead and participate in BI and IT projects, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to project goals.Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders and management.Coordinate with external vendors and service providers to support BI and IT initiatives.Documentation and Training:Develop and maintain technical documentation, including user guides, system manuals, and process documentation.Conduct training sessions for end-users to enhance their understanding and utilization of BI tools and IT systemsQualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and IT support.Proficiency in PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools is mandatory.Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems.Familiarity with ETL processes, data warehousing, and data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with other BI tools such as Tableau, QlikView, or similar.Knowledge of ERP systems, particularly VAI S2k.Understanding of WMS systems like BFC Dakota.Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and IoT solutions.Benefits:Competitive salary based on experience.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.401(k) retirement plan with company match.Paid time off and holidays.Professional development opportunities.

title: Test Automation Engineer
job description: Job Description:Required Skills, Experiences, Education and Competencies:Qualifications:Extensive ETL/Data testing skills (Functional/Performance/Regression testing skills )Experience in Data Automation & Cloud based testing toolsExperience in developing and implementing automation framework in Cloud environment.Experience in validating data, calculations at various stages including validation of attributes and transformation using data tools technologyExperience in Data Profiling and Test data creationDeveloping test automation and enabling DevOps through continuous testingWorking knowledge of AWS based data sources such as Aurora Postgres, Redshift, Athena, AWS Glue, DMS Services to deliver strong Quality solutionsGood understanding of continuous integration and deployment processes.Responsibilities:Develop comprehensive data verification and validation for backend data-oriented systems using modern frameworks such as Pandas, Informatica and other industry tools.Using scripting/programming languages like Python and R with a modern IDE (Anaconda, Jupyter notebook, or similar), and source code management products like GIT.Develops solutions to automate testing of databases and ETL processes built using technologies and frameworks such as SSIS, Oracle Integration products, Data Warehouse products and other industry tools.The hourly range for roles of this nature are $50.00 to $70.00/hr. title: Network/Systems Engineer
job description: A manufacturing company in the Philly suburbs is looking for a qualified Infrastructure Engineer to join their team. You will be responsible for overseeing the completion of projects and handling all end-to-end procedures, such as migrations, installations, upgrades, and implementations. You will take part in the planning and implementation of projects including Azure migrations, M365, VMWare ESXi, Cisco routing and switching, and Cisco ASA and Fortinet firewalls.They are searching for a person with a wide range of technical abilities, including proficiency with Cisco and Microsoft products.Responsibilities:Lead the execution of projects from initiation to completion, focusing on Windows/Microsoft technologies and occasional Cisco network projects.Engage in Windows Server administration, Microsoft 365 integration, and virtualization technologies (VMware, HyperV).Implement and manage Active Directory, Group Policies, Azure AD/ENTRA IDProvide support for Cisco LAN/WAN infrastructure, firewall installations, and route/switch configurations.Required Skills & Experience:Proven experience with Windows Servers and Microsoft 365.Expertise in virtualization technologies such as VMware and HyperV.Strong proficiency in Active Directory, Group Policies, and related enterprise identity solutions.Hands-on experience with Cisco LAN/WAN support, firewall installations, and route/switch configurations.What You Will Be Doing:Tech Breakdown:70% Windows/Microsoft, 30% Cisco Networking.Daily Responsibilities:70% Project Work, 20% Administration, 10% Support.The Offer:Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance.Bonus potential based on performance.Hybrid remote work schedule offering flexibility.Excellent company culture fostering collaboration and personal growth. Responsibilities: Required Skills & Experience: What You Will Be Doing: The Offer:

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
job description: Business Intelligence EngineerLocation:Philadelphia, PA (5 days a week onsite; potential for hybrid work after initial implementation)Salary Range:$95,000 - $115,000Job Summary:The Business Intelligence Engineer will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. This individual will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions, as well as providing IT support across various levels of the organization. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools, combined with the willingness to engage in hands-on technical work.Key Responsibilities:Business Intelligence and Reporting:Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions using PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools.Create and manage dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to support business objectives.Collaborate with various departments to gather requirements and ensure BI solutions meet business needs.Perform data analysis and provide actionable insights to improve decision-making processes.Develop and maintain data models, ETL processes, and data warehouses.IT Support:Provide help desk support to end-users, addressing technical issues and resolving them in a timely manner.Assist with the installation, configuration, and maintenance of hardware, software, and network systems.Troubleshoot and resolve IT-related issues, including system performance, connectivity, and application errors.Ensure data security and integrity by implementing and maintaining appropriate IT security measures.Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls.Project Management:Lead and participate in BI and IT projects, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to project goals.Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders and management.Coordinate with external vendors and service providers to support BI and IT initiatives.Documentation and Training:Develop and maintain technical documentation, including user guides, system manuals, and process documentation.Conduct training sessions for end-users to enhance their understanding and utilization of BI tools and IT systemsQualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and IT support.Proficiency in PowerBI and Cognos Reporting tools is mandatory.Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems.Familiarity with ETL processes, data warehousing, and data modeling.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with other BI tools such as Tableau, QlikView, or similar.Knowledge of ERP systems, particularly VAI S2k.Understanding of WMS systems like BFC Dakota.Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and IoT solutions.Benefits:Competitive salary based on experience.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.401(k) retirement plan with company match.Paid time off and holidays.Professional development opportunities.

title: Sr. Systems Integration Engineer
job description: Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)Job SummaryResponsible for technical planning and requirements creation for the integration and deployment of complex enterprise systems. Responsible for the creation and documentation of system configurations and guidelines. Create, organize, and distribute documentation as required to support an end-to-end integrated solution architecture. Responsible for the planning, coordination, development, and supervision of all requirements related to the integration of internal and external applications. Support integration systems defining the use of APIs, message formats, data mappings, and orchestrating the flow of information between systems. Support lab and field trial deployments to ensure the end-to-end integrated solution validation. The Systems Integration Engineer will join the software services and platform syndication team in support of designing integrated solutions and platforms while providing detailed documentation, guidelines, and implementing best practices.Job DescriptionCore ResponsibilitiesCollaborates with internal stakeholders to identify technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.Designs requirements to facilitate integration and data exchange between existing systems and newly developed adaptation systems.Designs requirements to facilitate integration and data exchange between developed adaptation systems and customer specific systems.Develops and documents guidelines for customer systems to successfully integrate with newly developed adaptation systems.Responsible for creation and tracking of complex configurations for end-to-end solution integration.Responsible for creation of requirements and development of traceability for integrated solution documentation.Responsible for transfer of integrated solution requirements to developers of adaptation systems.Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products.Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques.Provide expert advice to project teams on use of integration technology, data architecture, modeling, and system architecture including integration best practices.Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers requirements and documentation on time, to specification and within budget.Assist with incident response, troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and problem resolution of integrated systems.Communicate project status to various levels of management.Oversee the technology and standards for version control of solution requirements and documentation.Displays expertise in knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts and skills and their application in integrated systems.Displays expertise in process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical requirements to internal audiences.Displays expertise in process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical requirements to customers.Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.3+ years of experience in cable/telecommunications industry.Skills & Experience We’re Looking For:Understanding of key networking protocols and technologies – DOCSIS, HTTP/S, TCP, UDPFamiliarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols.Familiarity with data serialization formats like XML, JSON.Familiarity with advanced software technologies and environments.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively with a strong bias for architecting at scale.Employees at all levels are expected to:Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.Drive results and growth.Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. title: Junior VoIP Engineer/RingCentral

title: Sr. Martech Platform Engineer
job description: Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)Job SummaryWe are seeking a skilled Sr. Martech Software Engineer with expertise in marketing technology platforms (CRM or CDP) such as Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) or similar (e.g. Salesforce, Dynamics, etc), coupled with strong skills in building custom solutions on AWS, proficiency in API development using languages like Python or Java, and some experience in data engineering. The ideal candidate will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing martech solutions to drive marketing effectiveness and customer engagement. The Comcast Marketing Technology engineering team is responsible for developing, integrating and operating the capabilities marketing uses to engage in Direct Mail, Email, SMS and many other critical channels. Developers will participate in design, planning, development, release, monitoring and overall delivery of our web, mobile and application deliverables. The developer will be challenged to build new features and experiences that support millions of business & customer interactions each day while meeting the highest standards of availability, stability and performance. The right candidate will be outspoken and work to bring people together to help solve complex problems with an iterative approach!Job DescriptionResponsibilities:Martech Platform Expertise:Lead the implementation and customization of martech platforms such as Adobe AEP or similar CRM or CDP platform to support marketing campaigns and initiatives.Configure and integrate platform components to enable seamless data collection, segmentation, personalization, and campaign orchestration.Custom Solution Development:Architect, develop, and deploy custom solutions on AWS to extend the capabilities of martech platforms and address specific business requirements.Utilize Python and other relevant programming languages to build robust APIs, microservices, and integrations for seamless data exchange and automation.Data Engineering:Apply data engineering principles to design and optimize data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and analyzing marketing data.Implement data governance, quality checks, and monitoring to ensure the integrity and reliability of marketing data.AWS Infrastructure and Services:Design and implement scalable, reliable, and cost-effective solutions leveraging AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB.Utilize infrastructure as code (IaC) tools such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform to automate the provisioning and management of AWS resources.Technical Collaboration:Collaborate with marketing, analytics, and IT teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.Work closely with platform vendors, technical support teams, and external partners to troubleshoot issues and optimize platform performance.Innovation and Continuous Improvement:Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends in martech, API development, cloud computing, and data engineering to drive innovation and improve martech capabilities.Identify opportunities to automate processes, streamline workflows, and enhance marketing effectiveness through technology solutions.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Advanced degree preferred.3+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on marketing technology platforms such as Adobe AEP or similar.Proficiency in building and deploying custom solutions on AWS, with experience in cloud services, infrastructure as code, and serverless computing.Strong programming skills in an object oriented language (such as Python or Java) and experience developing APIs and microservices.Familiarity with data engineering concepts and tools such as data pipelines, ETL processes, SQL, and big data technologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop).Strong problem-solving skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.This role offers an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of marketing, technology, and data, driving innovation and impact in marketing technology solutions. If you are passionate about martech and possess the technical skills and experience outlined above, we encourage you to apply!Comcast is anEOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTemployer.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. Advanced degree preferred. 3+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on marketing technology platforms such as Adobe AEP or similar. Proficiency in building and deploying custom solutions on AWS, with experience in cloud services, infrastructure as code, and serverless computing. Strong programming skills in an object oriented language (such as Python or Java) and experience developing APIs and microservices. Familiarity with data engineering concepts and tools such as data pipelines, ETL processes, SQL, and big data technologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop). Strong problem-solving skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail. title: Junior Network Engineer / onsite Philly
job description: Join a dynamic healthcare organization in Philadelphia (onsite) dedicated to providing exceptional patient care and technological innovation. They prioritize a collaborative work environment and offer competitive compensation and benefits, including flexible schedules and bonuses.Job Description:They are seeking a Junior Network Administrator to join our team, consisting of a senior architect, engineers, and administrators. You will play a pivotal role in network operations, focusing on Cisco network installation, troubleshooting, and maintenance. This position offers hands-on experience with WiFi, firewalls, LAN/WAN, routers/switches, VPNs, and network automation, as well as opportunities to engineer and design networks for multiple data centers.Responsibilities:Install, configure, and maintain Cisco network infrastructure.Troubleshoot network issues and provide timely resolutions.Work with WiFi technologies, firewalls (including Cisco ASA), LAN/WAN configurations, routers, switches, and VPN setups.Implement network automation tools and scripts to streamline operations.Collaborate with the team on designing and engineering network solutions for various data centers.Requirements:2-5 years of experience working with Cisco networks.Proficiency in routing/switching protocols.Hands-on experience with Cisco ASA firewalls and VPN technologies.Familiarity with Cisco Meraki and network automation.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Preferred Skills:Knowledge of load balancers (Fortinet, F5).Additional certifications in Cisco or related technologies are a plus.Benefits: In addition to a competitive base salary, this position offers flexible work schedules, a modest bonus structure, and comprehensive benefits including healthcare coverage and retirement plans.

title: Azure Data Engineer with Commercial Pharma Exp. (1150)
job description: IntroductionAxtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsMax™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning and manage end-to-end commercial operations.With customers in over 75 countries, Axtria is one of the largest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is set up for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?Job Description:We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have years of recent experience in data engineering and hold a Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field. The Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and systems in Azure Cloud environments, with a strong emphasis on Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, and Microservices architecture.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain data pipelines in Azure Cloud environments, leveraging Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, and Microservices architecture.Design and implement scalable and efficient data processing solutions using technologies such as ServiceBus, REST API, App Service, SQL Data Warehouse, and Data Mart.Demonstrate proficiency in programming languages including Python, Spark, Databricks, Pyspark, SQL, and ML Algorithms.Implement Machine Learning models and algorithms using Pyspark, and other relevant tools.Manage Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, GitHub, and Kubernetes (AKS) for efficient software development and deployment.Implement ML/OPS solutions using Azure ML, Databricks MLFlow, and LLMOps for streamlined Machine Learning operations.Ensure data governance and data cataloguing standards are maintained, utilizing tools such as Collibra and Talend Data Catalogue.Collaborate with stakeholders to develop visualization and reporting solutions using Power BI, Tableau, and front-end frameworks like React.Create engineering prototypes for new market rollouts and refactor/modularize LLM model code to fit into the client's engineering frameworks.Run tests to assess KPI performance and troubleshoot and address problems with deployed models to improve user experience.Requirements:7 - 10 years of recent experience in data engineering.Experience in the Life-sciences domain, knowledge of Commercial Processes and Data sets.Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field.Proficiency in Azure Cloud environments, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Microservices architecture.Strong programming skills in Python, Spark, Databricks, Pyspark, SQL, ML Algorithms, Gen AI.Knowledge of Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, GitHub, Kubernetes (AKS).Experience with ML/OPS tools such as Azure ML, Databricks MLFlow, LLMOps.Familiarity with data governance, data cataloguing tools (Collibra, Talend Data Catalogue).Experience with visualization and reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau, and front-end frameworks such as React.Preferred Qualifications:Master’s degree in computer science or a related field.Experience working in Agile development environments.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Logistics and Location:We are hiring for Greater Philadelphia, PA LocationU.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.The exact nature of duties, level of role as well as the salary and compensation package will be commensurate with experience and salary history.Axtria is an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We offer attractive performance-based compensation packages including salary and bonus. Comprehensive benefits are available including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 401k with company match. Immigration sponsorship will be considered.#LI-NS1eGczDP8NLE Introduction Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is set up for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next? Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team. title: Job Posting Title DevOps Engineer - Global Automation Platforms
job description: Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)Job SummaryWe are integral members of the RDK Operations team within the Global Delivery Organization at TPX. Our team spearheads the transformation of automated testing methodologies for intricate Customer Premises Equipment, including TV, Streaming Boxes, Broadband Routers, and Smart Home Devices. In the domains of DevOps and software QA, our collective understanding underscores the critical significance of automated testing in upholding quality standards amidst continuous delivery. We engineer tools and platforms designed to streamline automation testing processes, yielding expedited results, extensive test coverage, and proactive bug identification. Acknowledging the limitations of conventional automation testing frameworks, particularly within the realm of sophisticated architectures inherent in leading-edge technologies, we stand out with our innovative solutions. Our methodology capitalizes on cutting-edge automation testing frameworks and tools tailored specifically for the intricacies of devices under test. In addition to application development, we prioritize the seamless delivery of our solutions as services to stakeholders utilizing similar products worldwide.Job DescriptionCore ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with department technology teams, both test and development to identify future automation framework scopes.Design and develop software frameworks, automation tools and scripts using modern test automation methods.Develop, test, and deploy reliable, efficient, and cost-effective test automation solutions. Provide support to QA/Dev/Ops in the utilization of these automation solutions.Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences.Works with technology partner/vendor teams to troubleshoot problems.Involved in defining and implementing continuous improvement process initiative.Serve as a guide and mentor for junior-level engineers. Provides technical leadership and consultation with regards to practices, procedures and techniques.Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary .Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Skills Required:Relevant proven experience in large scale software developmentExperience building and shipping services on KubernetesCollaborated with teams to write software to support cloud services at scaleProgramming experience in a relevant language, e.g. JAVA, PythonCI/CD Pipeline experience using concourse or relevant technologiesExperience in Docker, Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, tableau and JenkinsExperience in working with web services like REST and SOAP.Familiarity with database management using MySql, ELK , and Mongo DBPractical experience in developing complex test automation strategies, test scripts, and automation frameworkEmployees at all levels are expected to:Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.Drive results and growth.Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. title: Senior/Lead Python Developer (Django)
job description: Job Description Are you enthusiastic about contributing to a team and technology that revolutionizes the healthcare industry? This healthcare education SaaS company is committed to enhancing the efficiency of healthcare organizations. The goal is to cultivate an involved healthcare workforce dedicated to saving lives, and their platform equips healthcare providers and administrators with robust tools for managing data, conducting analysis, and streamlining operational workflows. Positioned within the dynamic startup landscape, the company is seeking motivated individuals who excel in fast-paced environments and embrace challenges. Every team member plays a vital role in our expanding organization, essential to realizing our ambitious objectives. Through a focus on excellence and customer satisfaction, they are establishing themselves as pioneers in academic medicine. If you are passionate about innovation, efficiency, and proactive problem-solving, consider joining us to make a meaningful impact. Why consider joining this team? Here, continuous learning is paramount. Mentorship is ingrained within the culture, encouraging individuals at all levels to expand their skill sets with new frameworks and techniques. Teamwork is highly prized, offering ample opportunities for engineers to enhance their abilities and influence the development of software platforms. Moreover, the team maintains a strong collaboration with Product. Are you an experienced Senior Python Developer seeking to join our expanding team? If so, read on... This position centers on developing scalable web applications and improving user interactions, ideal for individuals who excel in dynamic, high-impact settings. We seek a proficient leader with a strong background in full-stack development, particularly in Django/Python, and project management, capable of addressing global challenges. Choosing where to work isn’t merely a career decision; it's a life choice. Recognizing this, our organization prioritizes creating an inclusive environment where every employee feels supported in all aspects of their lives. We understand that individuals have commitments beyond work, so we offer a range of perks and benefits to ensure that work aligns harmoniously with your life. This role local to Philadelphia, PA with remote flexibility. No sponsorship or ability to work C2C available at this time. Required Skills & ExperiencePythonDjangoREST APIsVue.jsArchitectural designDesired Skills & ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.Minimum of 8 years of experience in software development, with substantial expertise in Django and Python.Proven experience as a tech lead or senior developer on multiple projects.Strong understanding of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and front-end build pipelines.Experience with Docker, CI/CD toolsWhat You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities80% backend Python/Django development20% architectural designThe Offer$180,000 DOEAdditional performance-based bonusesYou will receive the following benefits:Health, vision, and dental insurance.Paid Time Off.Annual all-expenses-paid team retreat.Complimentary meals on office days.Commute stipend.401k plan.Annual performance-based bonus.Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

job description: Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)Job SummaryThe AEGIS organization is responsible for building a suite of network design, drafting, visualization, and big data platforms that are transforming Comcast’s network expansion and outage detection/minimization capabilities. As a Principal Big Data & Systems Architect, you will lead the design and development driving the expansion of these platforms across the enterprise in addition to revising their architecture to support multi-tenancy and revenue generation via product syndication. title: Principal Statistical Programmer (Remote)
job description: If you are a current Jazz employee please apply via the Internal Career site.Jazz Pharmaceuticals plc (NASDAQ: JAZZ) is a global biopharmaceutical company whose purpose is to innovate to transform the lives of patients and their families. We are dedicated to developing life-changing medicines for people with serious diseases - often with limited or no therapeutic options. We have a diverse portfolio of marketed medicines and novel product candidates, from early- to late-stage development, in neuroscience and oncology. We actively explore new options for patients including novel compounds, small molecules and biologics, and through cannabinoid science and innovative delivery technologies. Jazz is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland and has employees around the globe, serving patients in nearly 75 countries. For more information, please visit www.jazzpharma.com and follow @JazzPharma on Twitter.The Principal Statistical Programmer provides Statistical Programming technical leadership and support to team members. The Principal Statistical Programmer is responsible for developing all aspects of statistical programming deliverables for the analysis of clinical study data in accordance with departmental SOPs and guidelines. Delegates tasks appropriately and tracks progress. The Principal Statistical Programmer may also construct estimates of project resource requirements and timelines and routinely briefs management on accomplishments, status of projects, and any issues. In addition, the Principal Statistical Programmer will be a designated member of CTWG team in the role of lead Statistical Programmer for clinical trial(s).Essential FunctionsAttend multi-disciplinary team meetings, representing the statistical programming function.Create or review and approve statistical programming plans at study and project level.Provide input on key study-related documents produced by other functions (e.g. CRFs, Data Management Plan, SAPs, etc.).Create or review and approve CDISC-compliant datasets and corresponding documentation for electronic submission to regulatory agencies.Develop software systems to generate displays of clinical study data as tables, listings, and graphs for electronic submission to regulatory agencies.Assist statisticians by suggesting algorithms to address novel analysis requests.Develop software validation procedures and test plans, as necessary.Create and document archives of software, outputs, and analysis files.Create and maintain department SOPs related to clinical programming.Review draft clinical reports, journal articles, slide presentations, and other documents to assure that results are reported accurately.Oversee work of internal contract programmers and external vendors.Provide time and resource estimates for project planning.Required Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesMinimum of 7 years of experience in developing software for clinical trials using the SAS system.Skilled in programming with SAS. Knowledge of additional programming languages a plus.Good knowledge of statistics and Oncology drug development process.Experience as a lead programmer for NDAs/BLAs.Experience overseeing the work of internal contractors and external vendors (CROs).Experience in pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamics modeling a plus.Familiarity with CDISC standards, including SDTM and ADaM models.Solid verbal and written communication skills.Required/Preferred Education and LicensesBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Life Sciences or other relevant scientific fields; Master’s Degree preferred.Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.FOR US BASED CANDIDATES ONLYJazz Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices and we strive to provide employees with total compensation packages that are market competitive. For this role, the full and complete base pay range is: $128,000.00 - $192,000.00Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors, including qualifications, skills, relevant experience, job knowledge, and other pertinent factors. The goal is to ensure fair and competitive compensation aligned with the candidate's expertise and contributions, within the established pay framework and our Total Compensation philosophy. Internal equity considerations will also influence individual base pay decisions. This range will be reviewed on a regular basis.At Jazz, your base pay is only one part of your total compensation package. The successful candidate may also be eligible for a discretionary annual cash bonus or incentive compensation (depending on the role), in accordance with the terms of the Company's Global Cash Bonus Plan or Incentive Compensation Plan, as well as discretionary equity grants in accordance with Jazz's Long Term Equity Incentive Plan.The successful candidate will also be eligible to participate in various benefits offerings, including, but not limited to, medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k retirement savings plan, and flexible paid vacation.
